title: Anti-Abortion Group in Wisconsin Is Hit by Arson, Authorities Say
summary: On May 8, 2022, the headquarters of the Wisconsin Family Action, an anti-abortion group, was attacked in Madison, Wisconsin. The assailant(s) threw a Molotov cocktail through a window, but it failed to ignite. However, another fire was set nearby, damaging part of the building. Graffiti was also found with the message, 'If abortions aren’t safe then you aren’t either'. No one was inside at the time, and no injuries were reported. The Madison Police Department, in collaboration with federal authorities and the Fire Department, is investigating the arson. This attack followed the leak of a draft ruling that could overturn Roe v. Wade, with Wisconsin having a pre-Roe abortion ban. Wisconsin Family Action advocates for conservative policies, including opposing abortion.
snippet: May 8, 2022. The headquarters of an anti-abortion group in Madison, Wis., was set on fire on Sunday morning in an act of vandalism that included the attempted use of a Molotov cocktail and ...

title: The Latest Fact Checks curated by Media Bias Fact Check 06/01/2022
summary: Media Bias Fact Check published a summary of various fact-checked claims on June 1, 2022. Politifact rated a claim by Ron Johnson as 'Mostly False' stating that several Democrats did condemn the vandalism at the Madison headquarters of an anti-abortion group. 'Check Your Fact' rated as 'False' a viral rumor that Senator Marsha Blackburn proposed birth control legality only for married couples due to lack of evidence. USA Today debunked the claim that Elon Musk could give every American $1 million with his $40 billion, stating that each would actually receive $120. A doctored video misquoted Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla, resulting in a false claim about population reduction. A photograph showed Kevin Spacey and Ghislaine Maxwell at Buckingham Palace, which was rated true by Newsweek. A claim by Francis Boulle about the FDA reporting high heart attack rates post-Covid-19 vaccination was found false; the statement was wrongly attributed and unverified by Full Fact.
snippet: MOSTLY FALSE: Claim by Ron Johnson (R): In the immediate wake of a fire and vandalism at the Madison headquarters of an anti-abortion group, Democrats had not condemned activists who are engaging in this repugnant illegal activity. Politifact rating: Mostly False (Numerous Democrats did condemn the incident, including Gov. Tony Evers, U.S. Sen. Tammy Baldwin, Attorney General Josh Kaul ...

title: Report: Madison Anti-Abortion Headquarters Set on Fire, Vandalized
summary: The Madison headquarters of Wisconsin Family Action, an anti-abortion organization, was reportedly vandalized and set on fire, with graffiti showing anti-police slogans and the phrase 'If abortions aren’t safe then you aren’t either.' The attack occurred late Saturday night or early Sunday morning, involving a Molotov cocktail that did not ignite, leading to a separate fire being started. No one was injured, and law enforcement, including the Madison Police Department and Fire Department, is actively investigating the incident. The attack followed a leaked draft Supreme Court opinion proposing to overturn Roe v. Wade, sparking protest from pro-abortion activists, who have been demonstrating across the country. Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers and Republican gubernatorial candidates condemned the violence, emphasizing peaceful expression of free speech. The police department plans to provide further updates.
snippet: Jacob Bliss 8 May 2022 0 The Madison headquarters of Wisconsin Family Action, an anti-abortion group, was reportedly set on fire late Saturday night or early Sunday morning after vandals threw what is believed to be at least one Molotov cocktail at the building.

title: Democrats' Radical Abortion Legislation - Ron Johnson Senator from ...
summary: Senator Ron Johnson from Wisconsin criticized the Democrats' proposed abortion legislation, calling it radical and expressing concerns over nationwide impacts on state pro-life laws. He highlighted that the proposed legislation would allow almost unrestricted abortions up to birth. Johnson condemned a recent attack by Jane's Revenge on a pro-life office in Madison and noted the lack of public condemnation from political figures like President Biden and federal agencies. He also addressed other issues such as coercive COVID-19 vaccine policies in the military, infant formula shortages, and law enforcement recognition during National Police Week. Additionally, he expressed support for school choice during National Charter Schools Week and discussed community engagement through the Joseph Project and his mobile office hours.
snippet: Unfortunately, members of the radical left have firebombed a pro-life office in Wisconsin and are threatening the safety of Supreme Court Justices and their families in an effort to intimidate them to impact their vote. Democrats have yet to condemn activists who are engaging in this repugnant illegal activity.
